intro: Verbascum chionophyllum, commonly known as the snowflake mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are large, velvety, and covered in soft, downy hairs, which help to retain moisture in arid conditions. Verbascum chionophyllum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential healing properties.
